thread.title: Confirmed: Man United legends coming Down Under
thread.title_full: Confirmed: Man United legends coming Down Under

title: Confirmed: Man United legends coming Down Under
text:
Manchester United Legends to play all-star Australian side in Perth in March  16am by Staff writers Source: FOX SPORTS A HOST of club icons will come to Australia next month when a Manchester United Legends side take on an all-star side of former Australians in Perth. 
Former Red Devils stars, including Paul Scholes, Dwight Yorke, Denis Irwin and Teddy Sheringham are all reportedly set to head west to face a Professional Footballers Australia Legends team coached by ex-Socceroos and Sydney FC boss Frank Farina. 
The West Australian reports Scholes is expected to play in the game, having 718 appearancs and scoring 155 goals over a 20 season career. 
Manchester United Legends will be playing the game to raise funds for Manchester United Foundation, who have selected local charity DT38 Foundation as one of those who will benefit. Manchester United legend Paul Scholes is expected to play. Source: AP 
“It’s an honour for our family to have Dylan’s foundation to be selected as one of the nominated charities that will benefit from such a momentous occasion,” said Jim Tombides, with DT38 Foundation set up in Dylan’s honour after the former West Ham and Young Socceroos striker passed away aged 20 in 2014. 
Bryan Robson will be coaching Manchester United Legends, with the game to be played at nib Stadium on Saturday 25 March. 
It follows the previous announcement that Premier League giants Chelsea would play a high profile pre-season friendly against Perth Glory in 2018, with a crowd of 65,000 expected. Taylor, Jim and Tracy Tombides with WA premier Colin Barnett unveiling Dylan Tombides’s statue outside nib Stadium. Source: News Corp Australia View All Comments The latest sports news, in your inbox daily. Email
